snippet: Like other developing countries, Nigeria has welcomed Chinese trade, but that relationship has left the country awash in shoddy imported goods and has cost many Nigerians their jobs.
abstract: Low-cost Chinese goods have flooded Nigeria, keeping prices affordable for millions of families; shoddy or counterfeit products plague Africa's biggest economy, but Chinese imports are so dominant that consumers have few other choices; China's complex relationship with developing countries is essential to its global ambitions (Series: The China Factor).

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Owen Guo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Like other developing countries, Nigeria has welcomed Chinese trade, but that relationship has left the country awash in shoddy imported goods and has cost many Nigerians their jobs.

headline.main: In Nigeria, Chinese Investment Comes With a Downside
